title: MixGuru
author: MixGuru
created_time: July 08, 2023, 09:51:43 AMLast edit: July 12, 2023, 10:34:06 AM by MixGuru

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Honestly, I don't see anything justifying the term "Most Effective" when it comes to mixers, because you don't offer anything that other similar services don't offer. However, you offer something you don't list as "Key Features", which is the ability to mix ETH and USDT.As for Switzerland, I would not agree that servers in that country provide any extra security, and I believe that the Swiss cooperate with everyone who sends them a request when it comes to possible money laundering, terrorist financing, and similar things.Since this service is new, I recommend caution until the legitimacy of the service is established.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Do you want to say that this is a legal money mixing service based in Switzerland or that the politically neutral laws of Switzerland will allow you to run an activity that will help clean up your money.QuoteIs mixing Crypto Legal?the legalities surrounding Cryptocurrency transactions is entirely dependent on your geographical location and the laws within your country.Is it legal in switzerland.In short, you provide a service provided by most mixers, so what is new or how will you compete with competitors?How TETHER mixer works?

comments.author: AB de Royse777
comments.body: Quote from: Lucius on July 08, 2023, 01:22:18 PMSince this service is new, I recommend caution until the legitimacy of the service is established.It takes time and consistency of providing service to build a brand. I am sure if the management is dedicated enough and have done research about their competitors then some day they will start attracting clients and establish a good business.Quote from: MixGuru on July 08, 2023, 09:51:43 AMWe're MixGuru! - For the past 2 years we have been developing an innovative & trusted mixing tool designed to restore & maintain on-block anonymity, using CoinJoin technology to provide users with untraceable coins, protecting their identity and keeping transactions private - All housed within a simplistic & accessible User-interface teamed with 24/7 customer support.2 years is a long time. The domain registered only couple months ago if I am not wrong. I am assuming you were in the development phase all those time and tested it offline. To improve the service I think you need a .onion version. You also need a dedicated bitcoin address that will represent your brand name and all sorts of verification should be done using this bitcoin address. A public PGP key will help too. Last but not the least, a proper marketing plan. Let me know if you already have that. I have bitcointalk marketing experience and providing the service for the last few years. I can help you with that if you need any improvement anywhere. Here is my service page: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5328445.0Welcome to the Bitcointalk community.

comments.author: Faisal2202
comments.body: Well come abroad, there is still room in the market for new project? I am happy though, and I hope you will follow the most legal way and set a model for everyone else in the world of crypto sphere.I am not a big user if mixers, but let's see what difference your features will make in compared to others. Previous members had already shared their thoughts and I have too. Keep shining like a star and be legit.

comments.author: Stalker22
comments.body: I noticed that you use some third-party scripts and Google fonts on your site. From my perspective, I have concerns about the implications of such choices for a service that prioritizes user anonymity.Code: (view-source:https://mix.guru/)<script src="https://www.google.com/recaptcha/enterprise.js?render=6LfJ9PMmAAAAAHNMBkDoHuqKcgfiSx9HCNXrlDlk"></script>Code: (https://mix.guru/style.css)@import url('https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Space+Grotesk:wght@300;400;500;600;700&display=swap');@import url('https://fonts.cdnfonts.com/css/sf-pro-display');QuoteA recent investigation into Google Fonts has revealed that the Tech Giant uses fonts to track what users are doing online and then sells the data to advertisers and marketing companies.Google is using fonts to track what users do online and sell data to advertisers. Here’s how - Firstpost.comHow Google is using FONTS to track what you do online and sell data to advertisers - dailymail.co.uk

comments.author: suzanne5223
comments.body: Welcome on board and I hope you enjoy the moment you have spent on this forum.It would be nice if you could add to your website the Tor link and ANN thread since this ANN stated you have a Tor browser integration.I like the aspect that you guys want to buy a service for ETH mixing which is something that's hard to get in the marketIn the meantime, I want to know that it's normal for us the people of this forum to be skeptical about new projects or crypto tumbler services until service legitimacy is shown and you can start by doing the necessary thing.If you need help with that you can reach out to me through PM so we can talk.

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote...untraceable coins & 100% anonymityThis sounds a lot like something a scammers would say, and I am sure you can't guarantee 100% anonymity with anything today.Another thing I noticed on your website is that you claim how you can mix 1000 Bitoins (or 20,000 ETH), that is more than 30 or 37 million dollars!and I really doubt you have that amount of coins, and you probably can't prove it by signing a message, am I right?I will have more times in next few days and I will check mix.guru website more and post my updates.

comments.author: o_e_l_e_o
comments.body: The site is absolutely filled with third party trackers and cookies: https://privacyscore.org/site/215742/. Mostly from Google but also from YouTube (lol).Large parts of the site are plagiarized. Just a couple of examples (there are many more):Quote from: https://mix.guru/MixGuru separates your personal identity from your wallet addressSay goodbye to pseudonymous transactions and experience true anonymity with MixGuruQuote from: https://[banned mixer/]UniJoin separates your personal identity from your wallet address.Say goodbye to pseudonymous transactions and experience true anonymity with UniJoin.Quote from: https://mix.guru/CoinJoin is distinct from mixing services in that CoinJoin technology operators never take custody of any funds.Quote from: https://river.com/learn/terms/c/coinjoinCoinJoin is distinct from mixing services in that CoinJoin operators never take custody of any funds.The whitepaper link is dead.The terms and condition link is dead.There is no onion link despite you saying there is one.I'm also super curious how you intend to coinjoin 1,000 BTC in a few hours and still provide any shred of privacy. The on-chain volume to do this simply does not exist.So in summary, this is most likely a scam.

comments.author: DaveF
comments.body: The OP scammer has been online since that 1 post and has not replied to anything posted here. Just looked they were on the forum a couple of hours ago.It looks like a scam, and smells like a scam, and the OP is not responding, just like a scammer.So, I'm going with scammer.Will tag later unless the OP comes back and responds.-Dave

comments.author: yhiaali3
comments.body: Another mixer!!! It seems to be a very profitable business.I don't know what a new mixer can offer that is superior to the mixers already on the market and now they have their name, New services always come with loud slogans, but they often turn off quickly.With regard to the presence of the server in Switzerland, I do not think that this makes any difference because I do not think that Switzerland will protect the mixer in the event that it obtains an official government request from any country, especially the United States and the Union, to conduct an investigation regarding money laundering or the like.

comments.author: Zoomic
comments.body: Quote from: Stalker22 on July 08, 2023, 09:59:01 PMI noticed that you use some third-party scripts and Google fonts on your site. From my perspective, I have concerns about the implications of such choices for a service that prioritizes user anonymity.This is even secondary because it is only people that understands privacy who knows what google does behind the scene. The primary things as link to the whitepaper and functionality of what they listed like Tether mixing is not functional.They claimed to have spent 2yrs on the project but the project appears to be the one done hastily. And also their domain age does not support their claim.Quote from: yhiaali3 on July 11, 2023, 02:35:21 AMAnother mixer!!! It seems to be a very profitable business.I don't know what a new mixer can offer that is superior to the mixers already on the market and now they have their name, New services always come with loud slogans, but they often turn off quickly.I may believe that mixing biz is more profitable than exchange biz. The market it broad for everyone who discovers a competitive advantage but that is far from Op.

comments.author: LeGaulois
comments.created_time: July 11, 2023, 01:07:35 PMLast edit: July 11, 2023, 01:55:06 PM by LeGaulois
comments.body: Very admin  I don't believe I'm supposed to be able to see this under cryptomix apiQuote"admin":{"getAdmins":{"method":"GET","path":"/api/admin","description":"Returns all admins","requirements":{"middleware":"authenticateToken"},"response":"Array of admin objects"},"createAdmin":{"method":"POST","path":"/api/admin/admin","description":"Creates a new admin","requirements":{"middleware":"authenticateToken"},"response":"Created admin object"},"authenticateAdmin":{"method":"POST","path":"/api/admin/admin/authenticate","description":"Authenticates an admin","response":"Authentication result"},"verifyToken":{"method":"POST","path":"/api/admin/admin/verify-token","description":"Verifies an admin token","response":"Verification result"},"refreshToken":{"method":"POST","path":"/api/admin/admin/refresh-token","description":"Refreshes an admin token","response":"Refreshed token"}}}Everything is fine under render.com?There are many points you have to improve honestly.(Sorry if it seems I'm hijacking the topic but it looks like a site in Beta)

comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: Quote from: LeGaulois on July 11, 2023, 01:07:35 PMVery admin  I don't believe I'm supposed to be able to see this with cryptomix apiQuote"admin":{"getAdmins":{"method":"GET","path":"/api/admin","description":"Returns all admins","requirements":{"middleware":"authenticateToken"},"response":"Array of admin objects"},"createAdmin":{"method":"POST","path":"/api/admin/admin","description":"Creates a new admin","requirements":{"middleware":"authenticateToken"},"response":"Created admin object"},"authenticateAdmin":{"method":"POST","path":"/api/admin/admin/authenticate","description":"Authenticates an admin","response":"Authentication result"},"verifyToken":{"method":"POST","path":"/api/admin/admin/verify-token","description":"Verifies an admin token","response":"Verification result"},"refreshToken":{"method":"POST","path":"/api/admin/admin/refresh-token","description":"Refreshes an admin token","response":"Refreshed token"}}}Everything is fine under render.com?There are many points you have to improve honestly.(Sorry if it seems I'm hijacking the topic but it looks like a site in Beta)It takes a shitton of work in order to build a service and keep it well-running. If you're even partially committed to the task, you will fall behind with service problems (especially if you're doing a solo project), and that's what seems to be happening here.It does not seem like a service that I would feel safe using, either. Particularly since this is within the realm of cryptocurrency.

comments.author: Bill Gates
comments.body: Quote from: MixGuru on July 08, 2023, 09:51:43 AMWe're MixGuru! - For the past 2 years we have been developing an innovative & trusted mixing tool designed to restore & maintain on-block anonymity, using CoinJoin technology to provide users with untraceable coins, protecting their identity and keeping transactions private - All housed within a simplistic & accessible User-interface teamed with 24/7 customer support. Domain Name: mix.guruRegistry Domain ID: 778ce9680f1f4019abadb008a27bd8d1-DONUTSRegistrar WHOIS Server: whois.namecheap.comRegistrar URL: https://www.namecheap.com/Updated Date: 2023-07-03T16:20:28ZCreation Date: 2023-06-08T15:01:47ZRegistry Expiry Date: 2024-06-08T15:01:47ZQuote from: MixGuru on July 08, 2023, 09:51:43 AM🔄 CoinJoin Technology CoinJoin breaks the heuristics used by chain analysis experts & companies and obscure ownership of specific pieces of Crypto. CoinJoin is distinct from mixing services in that CoinJoin technology  operators never take custody of any funds.Explain how CoinJoin is implemented by Mix.guru.Quote from: MixGuru on July 08, 2023, 09:51:43 AM🌐 No Web LogsWe do not keep activity logs of any kind.Having Google Captcha and keeping no logs. Ok.Quote from: MixGuru on July 08, 2023, 09:51:43 AM🇨🇭Servers based in SwitzerlandSwitzerland is politically neutral and is not a party to any foreign intelligence-sharing surveillance networks. Which means all user data is protected by some of the world’s strictest privacy laws.One Interpol notice and your server admin will shit in pant.Quote from: MixGuru on July 08, 2023, 09:51:43 AM🧅 Tor Browser Integration You can visit the MixGuru website by using the Tor browser to achieve the highest level of anonymity.Unless and otherwise special measures are taken, all clear-net sites are by default accessible by Tor. Nice of you to mention it as feature.TLDR: Guy has problem in basic concepts. More of a wannabe project, than a honeypot.

comments.author: Stalker22
comments.body: Quote from: Zoomic on July 11, 2023, 10:18:34 AMQuote from: Stalker22 on July 08, 2023, 09:59:01 PMI noticed that you use some third-party scripts and Google fonts on your site. From my perspective, I have concerns about the implications of such choices for a service that prioritizes user anonymity.This is even secondary because it is only people that understands privacy who knows what google does behind the scene. ~These things might seem secondary to the average user, but they should be privacy experts. They are running a crypto mixer, which should imply a higher level of online privacy awareness than the average person.If they lack an understanding of privacy and are unaware of what Google does behind the scenes, then it would be unwise for anyone to use their crypto mixer services.Quote from: Zoomic on July 11, 2023, 10:18:34 AMThe primary things as link to the whitepaper and functionality of what they listed like Tether mixing is not functional.They claimed to have spent 2yrs on the project but the project appears to be the one done hastily. And also their domain age does not support their claim.Indeed, there are numerous red flags, particularly when the OP attempts to delete or conceal evidence of the topic instead of addressing people's concerns and inquiries. Such behavior raises further doubts and undermines trust in his intentions.
